title: Animal Crime Victim Amendments

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel

general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the release and forfeiture of an animal that is being held because of abuse or involvement in a crime.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides a process to permit, while legal resolution of a crime is ongoing, the release or transfer of an animal being held in a shelter because the animal was abused or was involved in a crime;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a criminal penalty for unlawfully giving an individual access to an animal that the individual has legally forfeited ownership of due to abuse or a crime involving the animal;<hr><ltbullet>permits a peace officer in possession of a warrant to enter premises or a vehicle to aid or take custody of an animal that is being criminally mistreated or is associated with a crime;<hr><ltbullet>requires notice to the owner or possessor of the animal;<hr><ltbullet>permits a shelter or government counsel to file a motion to have a court review whether an animal being held in a shelter due to criminal activity should be forfeited or transferred to alternative care;<hr><ltbullet>provides procedures for the hearing and the court's determination, and permits the animal's owner to be heard as part of the hearing;<hr><ltbullet>provides procedures for placement of the animal if the court orders ownership of the animal to be forfeited;<hr><ltbullet>permits a court to order an animal owner to pay for the costs of sheltering an animal due to the owner's criminal activity;<hr><ltbullet>permits a court to order an individual who has abused an animal or involved an animal in criminal activity to complete an educational or animal cruelty prevention program;<hr><ltbullet>provides cross references for the forfeiture procedure; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
